meanings.definition: To create a new dance routine.
meanings.sent1: She decided to rechoreograph the ballet to make it more exciting.
meanings.sent2: The dance instructor had to rechoreograph the routine for the upcoming recital.
meanings.sent3: The dancers laughed as they tried to rechoreograph the dance in silly costumes.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful movements seemed to rechoreograph the very essence of the music.
meanings.sent5: The choreographer's task was to rechoreograph the entire performance from scratch.

meanings.definition: To rearrange or modify an existing dance routine.
meanings.sent1: They needed to rechoreograph the group number to fit the smaller stage.
meanings.sent2: After feedback from the judges, the team decided to rechoreograph their routine.
meanings.sent3: The dance crew had to rechoreograph their routine after one member kept forgetting the steps.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in music forced them to rechoreograph the entire routine on the spot.
meanings.sent5: The choreographer had to rechoreograph the finale to make it more visually appealing.
